dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: A clock alarm SOUNDS over TITLES on BLACK.  We HEAR someo clearing congested lungs, coughing up phlegm; a slight cr STOPS both the cough and the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage is a tiny, peeling paint rat-trap set dead ce on a small ocean front cul-de-sac, surrounded by four mas post-modern mansions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE NELSON, 42, squints and shivers as the spotty morn light and ocean breeze enter through an open window.  Bol waves crash against the cliffs outside the room.  A five- wide stack of hand hewed beams are piled pyramid style, making movement in the room next to impossible.  George stands shirtless in underwear and coughs again.  He steps over a pile of tools and stands at the window, facing the sea.  A happy sounding tune by Guster, "WHAT YOU WISH FOR begins with the lyrics: 'Woke up today, to everything gra and all that I saw just keeps going on and on...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The post-modern house is three-levels of concrete and gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM is sixteen with spiky black hair, a nose ring, two earrings and painted black nails.  The song continues wit '...sweep all the pieces under the bed, close all the curtains and cover my head.'  Sam looks wasted as he clim out of bed and rummages through his dresser, retrieving a empty bottle of prescription drugs; he tosses the bottle. walks to a desk where a half-built model of a house sits unfinished and squeezes glue into a plastic bag and sniff it.  Sam enters the closet and digs into a pile of dirty clothes, pulling out the tie to a robe; he knots it aroun the closet pole and then twists it once to form a noose. slips his neck through the noose and lowers his body; tho we don't see exactly what he's doing below his neck, it's evident through his jerking arm that he's masturbating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLLEEN BECK, George's next-door neighbor, is a well maintained blonde in her late thirties.  She walks out of angular concrete mansion, grabs the paper and walks back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a minimalist kitchen, with pored concrete walls a stainless steel cabinets.  Colleen drops the paper on the table and walks to the sin wash her hands.  The SONG CONTINUES: '...If this serenade not what you want, it's just how it is...'  Colleen appea distracted for a moment.  She walks outside onto the terr with wet hands, then bolts back in, breezing through the kitchen with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALYSSA is sixteen and perfect with strawberry blonde hair white teeth; her head is partially out the bathroom windo Colleen bursts in, eases Alyssa aside and with effort, st her head out of the same high open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must not see exactly what they see, but out the window almost beyond view, a stream of urine arks out from Georg Nelson's beach house bedroom, into the pacific ocean some twenty-feet below.  The piss stops.  Colleen bangs her he trying to get it back inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBIN WEBBER is George's ex-wife, still beautiful at fort She herds two boys, RYAN (8) and ADAM (7), down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run downstairs and give your dad a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be gone for his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we have a party for him while he's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stops and KNOCKS on a bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're showered and ready for school!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud CRASH stops Ryan and Adam at the top of the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin rushes in and glances around the room for her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet pole and a long line of clothes have been fell by Sam's dangerous whack-off technique; he's on the floor with the robe tie still around his neck and a pile of shi sprawled over him.  The song continues: '...come out come out, wherever you are, would you do it all over right fro the start, and what you wish for won't come true, you are surprised to love, are you?'  Robin stops at the door, trying to figure out why her son sitting in a pile of his own clothes.  Ryan and Adam join her, looking equally perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's dog, GUSTER, is doing his business on the lawn o modern day robber baron, DAVID DOKOS, who exits his house with a briefcase.  He hops into his Mercedes and proceeds chase Guster straight across his well-manicured grass.  Guster easily escapes death and runs off.  George walks o of his shack as David hops the curb, flips him off and dr away.  George waves goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick it up your ass!  Have a nice day.   (glancing around) Guster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster runs to his side as Colleen rushes out of her hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has got to stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He escaped.  He's going back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it give you some sort of perverse pleasure to expose your...penis in plain view of my sixteen year-old daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no windows facing my...exposure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, this is the third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plumber's due out on Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to explain that to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the only neighbor I could tolerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did warn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is a warning.  I just can't figure out for what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen shies away from George's stare; he finally turns walks toward the house but stops short as he turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen, how hard was it for you to get your head outside that window far enough to see my dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Colleen for a moment; it was difficult.  Georg walks back to the cottage and locks Guster in before step into an old Ford truck and driving off.  Colleen watches drive off, then turns to her house and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER WEBBER, Robin's husband, is a distinguished, intimidating man with silver hair and an expensive suit.  LOIS, the maid, serves French toast to Ryan and Adam as R sips tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam broke his closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter glances at Robin, who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a clue anymore.  I wish you'd talk to him.  He needs a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father is a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man he respects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks into the room from the hall, outfitted in all b with kick ass boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for talking about me behind my back...useful in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing eye shadow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Ryan and Robin check out the eye shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam flutters his eyelids in defiance of his stepfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I walk out the door, who's gonna be here tonight for the follow through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hesitates for just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's out the door with his eye shadow intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad said it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin focuses on Peter, who simply shrugs.  Adam stands u walks over to his father and gives him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get chocolate cake for your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your hands clean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is quick to back away from his father and lick the fingers of one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is resting his head against the glass window as he stares out at the blighted landscape leading to downtown Angeles.  A sudden pang tightens his face; he presses his hand against his stomach and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is alone at the back of the parking lot, sitting on t hood of an old Saab, smoking as two boys, JOSH and MAREK, both seventeen, park a Porsche and pull Alyssa Beck (Geor peeping neighbor) and another girl out of the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, nice look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam simply nods as Marek and the other girl laugh at his black garb, earrings and eye shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your dad this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drops his cigarette and stomps it out as he stands; h face lightens as Alyssa waves before walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours a week for three-hundred cash.  The whole summer.  Do the math. (as a dig) They consider that a hatchback or a station wagon?  Oh, that isn't yours anyway, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh raises his eyebrows and smiles before walking away. faces the Saab and kicks the bumper as hard as he can.  Suddenly, a boy (COREY) bolts up from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in total REM, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The architectural firm of Benson and Feinsilber occupies entire fortieth floor; George Nelson is their sole model maker.  Rather than offices, most of the space is open, segmented only by portable low walls.  Along the outer wa below the long line of windows, is a shelf filled with amazingly intricate models.  George is alone in a cubicle his own, cutting polystyrene with a hot wire.  STEVEN GAR rounds a corner with a velocity that makes George flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done...close to done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the grass.  Who said grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven exits as quickly as he entered, but as soon as Geo goes back to work, Steven pops his head back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke bided out the Berlin Plaza.  Did he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to start Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes the look of the computer models, anyway.  You take too long. (beat) After you mow the grass, would you mind bringing the house to my office?  I have a presentation to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George simply stares as Steven nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is by himself, his eyes closed, listening to music through headphones as Alyssa stops to stare; she visually scans him head to foot, appearing slightly perplexed as a friend passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't make a habit of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The friend walks on; after a beat, Alyssa does too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the sun colors the sky a blinding orange it sets.  A Range Rover with blackened windows is parked behind a Porsche.  'TINTED WINDOWS,' an up-tempo tune wit hand clapping by the Pansy Division, begins: 'A bed would a treat/But all we've got is this backseat/Tinted windows a beautiful thing.' Through the front windshield, we can see Marek sitting in passenger's seat with his eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Josh, Marek's friend, is sitting on a bench in the park behind the cars. 'A dark secluded spot/In a deserted park lot/Tinted windows are a wonderful thing.'   Suddenly, the passenger door on the Rover opens and Marek climbs out, brushing his hair with his hands before casua checking his zipper.  He closes the door and the car spee away.  Josh walks to Marek and wordlessly they climb into Porsche and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shirtless in his front yard, hand hewing a twen foot beam.  One strong, long pull and a thin shaving flut to the ground; Guster nabs it and starts to chew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll crap real logs if you keep eating wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster appears unconcerned as he awaits a new shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George glances up, wipes the sweat from his forehead as Alyssa walks toward him in white shorts and a tee shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I got you into trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George goes back to works and Guster taste tests shavings Alyssa searches for something else to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Sam have any friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George stops and looks up; he has no idea how to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you his friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn Manson...and I guess he's into guys.  I hate nose rings.  And the blue eye shadow thing really isn't working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is totally confused, unsure most of the answer, bu before he can question her, a police car pulls to a stop; OFFICER KURT WALKER steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I'd run over the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Walker removes a pad from his pocket and flips through to find his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is such a street of whiners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Tuesday to yesterday, not including Monday or today.  Okay...Mrs. Dokos is repeatedly running over her lawn.  The Corliss' have attributed the increase in rat population in their environs to the state of your...structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IPO's caused the rat population on this street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Walker focuses on Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course the Beck's, with the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could have been a squirt gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to George) You've been good this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot David Dokos and Tom and Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt stuffs his pad back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dokos calls animal control for Guster and I was out here on the other. (pointing to the plane) Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George hands him the plane and Kurt begins to work the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys' friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've known each other since grade school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, but did you both go camping on weekends?  Listen to music?  Masturbate together?  Talk on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George doesn't answer and Kurt keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunted rabbit in the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa stares at George, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I aimed high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just weren't very much alike, I guess.  I don't know. (casually; to George) I liked your dad more than I liked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want you as a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George just never really...aimed that high.  Even with not hitting a rabbit.  I  knew you were doing that, by the way.  That's why I stopped doing it with you.  You were no fun.  It was always like you were frightened.  Quiet and boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt is beginning to perspire as he shaves food off the b for Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how he's the architect and you're just a loud mouth cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He builds models for architects.  His dad, on the other hand, was the real deal.  Designed and built the coolest houses I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was bankrupt and dead before I was twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left you this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in my name so he wouldn't lose it.  He stole it from everyone that deserved it by putting me on title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I'd give to have this!  Forget how I got it!  I can't afford dirt in this town.  I live in Riverside, Goddammitt  And you get to piss in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt stops working and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kid was down around Diver's Cover again, smoking pot.  I didn't write him up...told him I wouldn't tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for telling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least your father tried, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt walks to his car and drives off.  There's a moment o awkwardness with Alyssa.  George walks into his house lea Alyssa with Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is sitting at the kitchen counter, cutting carrots; through the French doors, she's able to watch Ryan and Ad along with a few friends, play in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin jerks with fright as half the carrots roll to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you stay you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George picks up the carrots and washes them in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should lock your doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring the bell before you try the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George bites into a carrot as Robin starts chopping again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Sam call to tell you he wouldn't be over this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him pierce his nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin snatches the carrot from George's hand and chops it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he always is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes Robin's hand and removes the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I don't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As George lets go, Robin holds on; he appears surprised b her grip of his wrist.  Robin's eyes well with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have knocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is clearly not comfortable with his ex-wife's hold him, with her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a mother can't stand her son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George jerks his arm away from her grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is tense and he walks to Sam's door and KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you coming in for the weekend? (beat) Sam?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  George tries the door - it's locked.  Frustrate he walks back down the hall and down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the boys are engaged in a raucous version of Mar Polo.  Robin is at the sink; she holds her hair back with hand and splashes water on her face with the other.  Geor walks by outside, carrying a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is the first to notice  George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not cheating!  I'm not looking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin wipes her face with a hand towel as she rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys have stopped playing; Adam opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he have a lock on his door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he put the lock on!  Do you think I told him he could have a nose ring?!  Why do you ask me everything you should ask him!?  I don't know anything, anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys line up against the edge of the pool and watch George extend the ladder against the house and climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You climb up there and tell him what he can and can't do.  Take him for the summer, okay?  Whip him into shape.  Cut his hair.  Make him smile.  Let him hate you for a while! (sadly) You're too late for heroics, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George lops a leg over the railing and steps onto the bed balcony.  He peers into the room through the sliding glas door and tries to open it (locked) before removing the sc to the small open window beside it.  He climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is asleep on his bed in his underwear, wearing headphones.  On the floor is an aerosol can of whipping cream.  George picks up the can and tosses it in the tras He focuses back on his son with his nose ring, earrings, eyeshadow and thin, pale white body.  Sam is soundly asle George gently removes the headphones from his son's head; drum heavy music surges from the small, padded speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need every brain cell you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK on the door stirs Sam more than his father's voic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-asleep) Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's eyes are still closed as he shifts onto his side.  George opens the door; Robin is weak and weepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do, anymore.  Take him.  You take him. (hostile) You're such a good father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks out of the room, around Robin and down the stairs without a word.  Sam stirs at the sound and sits u confront his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't go in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I locked the door!  Get out!  I locked the door!  Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin grabs the door and closes it quickly, but doesn't m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch!  Liar!  I locked the door!  I don't sneak around your room!  Liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes over to the window and stares down at the scre and ladder.  Ryan, Adam and their friends are still in th pool, holding onto the coping, staring up at Sam.  Sam sl the window shut and searches for the can of whipping crea He gets down on his knees to search under the bed.  Stand and making one more pass of the room, he notices the can the trash.  He instantly focuses all his rage at the clos door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my room!  You have no right in here!  This is mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is sitting on the floor at the top of the stairs, staring blankly down at the foyer of this modernist mansi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you all just die and leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic is thick and loud and the sky is a blanket of brown as George makes his way down a sidewalk mixed with professionals and panhandlers.  Suddenly sick, George rus to the side of a building and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George wipes a clump of wet paper towel against the vomit stain on his cuff as he walks through the pockets of cubi to a large enclosed office.  A SECRETARY smiles as she st up from her desk and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the wad of wet paper towels, but before he c say trashcan, BRYAN BURKE stands up from behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, have a seat!  I've got juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George steps in and the secretary closes the door to the office.  Bryan approaches with his arm outstretched, but George can only raise the paper towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird caught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan grabs a trashcan and holds it up; George tosses the ball into the trash and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange juice...croissant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan motions with his hand as he sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: how much weight have you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...nothing.  Thirty pounds.  I just haven't been very hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we divorce a decade ago, she was very, very angry. (beat) Now she's just hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan nods and laughs as he takes a chunk of croissant an chews as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...she married...what was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buys and sells the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Webber!  Right.  Quite the spotlight on that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did tell you, didn't I?  That I'd be ready to start the Berlin model today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's sort of...you're sure you're not hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is anxious as he holds up the rest of the croissant George shakes his head "no".  Bryan tosses his croissant the trash can and leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't me. (beat) We can show clients endless options, change anything in a matter of hours on the computer.  But you won't change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typing and clicking myself to renderings isn't why I started building models.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us are typing and clicking, George.  Whether we want to, or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why we bid out a quarter of our projects.  It doesn't make a lot of sense anymore to want what we don't have and don't want what we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George glances around the office, angered by the thought being fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been here twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) Maybe...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods as he stares at Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, they decided on a week a year severance, but I got them to twenty-six.  That's six months salary, George.  Medical and everything for six months.  You can learn all you need to on the computer long before that.  Maybe find a job closer to home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is rattled by George's blank stare.  He takes his g of orange juice and sits back in his chair, taking a sip, the while keeping an eye on George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife left me because I wasn't...very emotional.  I kept trying to explain that my father sucked all the emotion from me.  Drunks do that, sometimes.  Make their kids afraid.  Make them unwilling to express themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan knows he's supposed to say something, he just can't seem to figure out what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were probably in school together.  You went to Berkley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan lights up at the sound of his Alma matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class of eighty-six!  I didn't know you were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a sophomore when I got the call my parents were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the direction Bryan had hoped the conversatio was headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad had a blood alcohol level of .18.  A little high.  Drove right into oncoming traffic.  Killed my mother with him.  A lady in another car.  Hurt her daughter.  A five-year old girl.  I think about her still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan wants this to end.  He leans forward with a whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...maybe I can get you a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  You love your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the day I started...to today.  Can't stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan is perplexed as George stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it sounds like I'm doing you a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may sound that way, but I react out of fear.  My life has nothing to do with what I like or don't like.  You haven't been listening, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know there would be a quiz, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I feel better about this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I was hoping for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved and not understanding anything about irony, Brya stands and extends his hand.  George shakes Bryan's hand without malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got one favor to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I built my first model here when I was twenty.  There are hundreds of them on shelves around the office.  Twenty years of my life.  I was wondering if I might be able to pick a few to keep, to take home?  Only the ones that really mean something to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan recoils slightly from the request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well...those are...I mean, we don't get to keep our work.  I could maybe ask them if you could choose one.  But, you know, frankly George, you were the best.  Computer models can't begin to match the beauty you gave yours.  They're a part of this firm.  They inspire me.  I go out there and sometimes just stare at something I've designed.  It amazes me.  I would miss that too much. (beat) Look, I may be going out on a limb, but you go out there and look them over, every single one of them and pick the one you like the best and take it with you.  Just run it by me first, just in case, you know...but I'm sure it'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's the least I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods and leaves.  Bryan looks lost and guilty agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks around the maze of cubicles back to his own. finds an empty box and starts to pack.  Against a wall, a large rack is filled with spools of architectural plans.  George pulls one of the plans down, rolls it out and deta the wooden spool.  Without warning and with a fury hard t fathom, he proceeds to bat and smash a shelf of beautiful rendered models.  Heads pop up in other cubicles as Georg walks out of his own and armed with a frightening rage, methodically attacks model after model resting on shelves just below massive plate glass windows that frame downtow Los Angeles.  Steven Gardner, who asked for his model wit grass, rushes to within feet of George as he witness his creation deconstruct into shards of cardboard and plastic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God!  Not my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George stops for a second to focus on Steven, but Steven smart enough to run.  George continues on with the busine of disassembling his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, please, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plea is instantly followed by a pathetic low whine.  George works up a sweat as he whacks model after model; portions of plastic walls or window splatter the office a though bombed in war.  Bryan Burke's secretary inches as close as she dares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Mr. Burke would like a word with you, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George lowers his stick as he faces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his office.  When you're able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, George finishes what he began only minutes pri the complete and utter destruction of every model display on every shelf in the office, save one.  Workers huddle together, collectively moaning and moving en mass from th mayhem.  George picks up the sole surviving model in his and cradles it carefully as he walks into Bryan Burke's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan cowers behind his desk as George enters with his mo in one hand and the long wooden stick in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take this one, if that's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Bryan a few aborted attempts to answer before he simply nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for going out on a limb and allowing me one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan nods again, then quivers as George steps forward, l the stick against the desk and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great architect and a miserable human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan winces as he extends his hand.  They shake hands an George grabs hold of the stick again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks around the desk and bashes in a model hidden the floor, one that Bryan had obviously wanted to save.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George drops the wooden spool and walks out of the office Bryan garners the courage to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even an architect and you're a miserable human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George turns around only long enough to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  You win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George closes the door behind him.  Bryan stares down at remains of the model; he gets down on his knees and caref gathers up the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is sweating as he walks with his box of personal i under one arm and the model under the other.  Dizzy, he s for a moment and tires to orient himself, glancing one wa then the other before staggering back and pressing himsel against the building for support.  Sweat beads and drops his nose and chin as the song, 'ACROSS THE UNIVERSE' begi by The Beatles.  George sets the box down but clings tigh to the model as he closes his eyes.   'Pools of sorrow, waves of joy are drifting through my op mind, possessing them, caressing me...' George drops face first to the cement, crushing the model beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE SONG CONTINUES
dialogues.text: George is probed and poked by doctor after doctor.  An ultrasound test followed by a CT scan, followed by a MRI results in more tests. A flexible tube is slid down George's throat as dye is sh into his body.  'Sounds of laughter, shades of life are ringing through my open view, inciting them, inviting me. A long blunt needle is shoved into George's side for a bi of his pancreas.  X-rays are lit and highlighted as docto ponder the specks, the disease.   Finally, George is opened up; nearly bloodless slice thro skin, muscle and fat reveals death. 'Limitless undying lo which shines around me like a million suns, which calls m and on across the universe...'  George is wheeled down a long hall to the critical care u 'Nothing's going to change my world, nothing's gonna chan my world...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George tries to sit up, but falls back as he closes his e opens his eyes, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That took care of the pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George opens his eyes again as an attractive NURSE enters with a tray of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse smiles as she lifts the cover off the dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No food.  I'm painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises George's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you had three or four months to live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse glances over at the other patient in the room, who's sleeping, before answering in a soft voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd eat a lot of red meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse smiles as she sits down beside the bed.  She fi a spoon with corn and aims it for George's mouth; he acce the good will, chews and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd build a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes another spoonful of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what mortise and tenon is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse shakes her head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got every part of it ready.  It's like a jig saw puzzle...all in pieces now, just waiting to make sense.  I've been through design and review...the planning commission, city council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She feeds George another small spoonful of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's really said four months is all you have, have they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stage four pancreatic cancer.  They haven't even pretended to offer treatment.  You tell me, when would you start eating red meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you build a house in four months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can die trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse rests her hand for a moment on George's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been touched in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly alarmed by her emotion, the nurse removes her ha and stands back away from George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't know what that was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handshake, or you know, someone pats you on your back through clothes.  Doctors, people who have to touch you.  But not by people who want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  A friend... your mother?  Everybody gets touched by someone they love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that weird?  I mean, I dated a little bit after my divorce, for four or five years.  Six years.  I know when my son was younger...maybe when he was ten or eleven even, he'd run up and wrap his arms around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George suddenly stops to catch his emotion.  The nurse ch the door before walking back to George; she brushes back hair with both hands, then fingers the curves of his ears finally resting her thumbs on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling guilty, she flees the room, waking the other PATI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is resting, eyes closed, sitting on a bench with h box and the remnants of the model beside him.  A black Ra Rover pulls to a stop with a HONK.  George stands to gath his things as Robin steps out of the car, yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called everyone, everywhere!  You just vanished!  You could be dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for waking me up.  Picking me up.  You're loud today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're inconsiderate and absolutely devoid of emotion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the most beautiful woman I have ever known in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is stumped for a second, confused by the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking just physically.  Even your anger is perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin climbs back in the car and slams her door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sets his box in back and climbs into the front sea Robin takes off.  He closes his door as she runs a stopli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd know I went missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think someone from your office would call and tell me you wrecked the entire building and threatened people with a baseball bat?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blueprint spool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been for a week?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four days.  I left to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with your dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's been feeding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't call me while you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't thinking.  Look, I'm sorry I didn't think to call you while I thought...I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George raises his eyebrows, wanting just the slightest gi from Robin.  She glances at him, but won't yield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they tow your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was parked in day parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tear down the shack and build my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been saying that for twenty years.  While we were dating, you said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing anymore to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Severance pay.  And I'm going to cash in my life insurance policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many years did I live with your beams and boards?  First in the garage, then in the living room.  We're going to do it, Robin.  Next year.  Next year.  Salvaged floorboards from a house in Pasadena.  Doors from a church in New Hampshire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love those doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I wasn't serious about you taking Sam, so you don't have to get into any actual construction to get out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's school over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friday...God, I hate the thought of him home all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be by Saturday to pick him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to spend the weekends with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for the weekend.  For the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Sam are going to live in a garage without plumbing for the summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is plumbed.  I'll put in a toilet.  We'll survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for at least sounding sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounding?  I need help.  He's cheap labor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you would end up dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we'll have a house to show for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, really.  I'll survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.  Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George rests a hand on the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Sam for the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin furrows her brow for a moment and glances at George It takes a while for her to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George rests his hand on Robin's cheek for a moment, as t nurse had done with him.  Robin turns her head and bites finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods as he mock nurses his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is walking with Corey, who's wiry and wan with a red nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole summer, man.  Party in Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be my brother the dweeb on weekends.  All we gotta do is sand and paint the cabin, dude. (boasting) My dad's gonna let me use the boat and my charm is gonna let me use my rod.  Income village is the place to hook up with hump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it beats letting town folk go down on you for the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops which stops Corey.  Sam glances around to make no one's listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said anything.  I haven't done anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the deal is.  Josh is a pimp.  I'm not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what the deal is.  There is no fucking deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks away pissed that Corey knows what the deal is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shirtless, the stitches still fresh on his side carries/drags his mattress into the garage.  Alyssa walks from her house to the garage and peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is making his bed, which is not easy because Guste curled up on it.  The one car garage is not dry-walled an the cement floor is clean but stained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George steps away from the bed, slightly rattled by Alyss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you put a toilet and a bed in your garage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm living here while I build another house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that legal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sits down on the bed beside Guster and starts to bounce up and down.  George takes another step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa lies down on the bed, lifting the sheet to her nos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these clean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is alarmed.  Guster licks Alyssa's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George bangs his head with his hand and starts to search room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa reaches out and slides a finger down his scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I cut myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George pats down his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had them in my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not shaving my legs or pits this summer, I've decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George opens the drawers of a small desk and a chest, not paying attention to Alyssa as she raises her leg and runs hands down the stubby skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paula Cole isn't a vertical kisser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George dabs his keys from the floor beside the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the bed for me, would you?  I gotta run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George turns around to Alyssa's leg up and a great view o her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, forty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George whirls around to face Colleen as Alyssa lowers her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot where I put my keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought they might be under her dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just showing him my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa miffed as she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need to rethink what you think of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks around her mother and out of the garage.  Colleen stares at George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her leg hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George drives the four miles North to Robin's house liste to Paula Cole.  He turns into Emerald Bay, a guard-gated community and a Guard waves him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George rushes from his car and tries the front door, but locked.  He rings the bell and LOIS, the maid, answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Webber is in the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his room, packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has a CD by MARYLIN MANSON on loud as he packs a suit on his bed.  The KNOCK on the door is barely heard.  ANOT KNOCK draws his disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's face turns sour as he yanks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs and returns to finish his packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll have fun this summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nearly impossible to hear George over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is quickly driving George crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind turning it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't register with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't all be work, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is once again, seemingly unheard.  He walks to wit inches of Sam and grabs his head and yells into Sam's ear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be all work, you know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls away from the touch and turns the music off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to the sliding glass door and stares down at boys and Robin in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom and the boys can drop by anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To check up on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be around to check up on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in Cory's parents' cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Adam are on their backs on rafts as Robin swims between them.  Suddenly, like a UFO crashing to Earth, Sa suitcase spirals downward straight into the pool, barely missing both Adam and Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking way!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are knocked off their rafts as Robin takes off h goggles and focuses on Sam up on his balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liar!  You stupid liar!  I hate you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George bursts out of the kitchen, onto the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him he's spending the summer with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam storms off the balcony, back into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do?  When you didn't show up Saturday, I tried to call.  Your phone isn't working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drove over and you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time you were gone for a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him he was spending the summer with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I was going to let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not spending the summer in Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks out of the kitchen to confront his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, anyway?  I don't even know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll know me by the time we're through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get your bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to the edge of the pool and scoops up the suitcase, holding it out as it drains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, tell him I'm not going.  You already promised me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is in an uncomfortable position as she glances at S before focusing on George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did say he could go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's eyes well with tears as his voice cracks.  Robin is ready to concede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) He's not spending the entire summer with another kid in Tahoe.  If he leaves, I will follow him up there and I will drag him home by his nose ring.  He can hate me.  You can hate me.  He can try to kill me while I sleep.  You can call the police.  You can call your husband or your attorney, but Sam is spending the summer with me.  He's my son.  He's sixteen.  That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is crying now -- snot's running down his nose.  Robin shocked by George's forcefulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we hate you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to Sam and touches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get in the truck, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam jerks away from his dad as dramatically as he can man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George drops the suitcase and grabs Sam by the arms.  As as Sam tries to resist, he's clearly no match for his fat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your nose ring comes out of your nose.  If you've got them in your nipples, they come out, too.  And there's no make-up at my house.  No glue sniffing.  Huffing.  No pills, no grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hit me, I'll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've worn out your welcome at this house, Sam.  I won't ever hit you.  (beat) This may well be the worst three months of your life, but you've earned it.  So, pick up your suitcase and go get in the truck.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hate you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even begins to know how much I hate my father. (upbeat) Think of it as a family tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glares at his mother before grabbing his soggy suitca and stomping out of the backyard.  Robin is stunned silen George's decisiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is pressed against the passenger side door.  George w from the backyard and opens the truck door to climb in bu stopped by Sam's suitcase.  He lifts it out and sets it i the bed, then slides into the cab, sitting on the soaked seat.  George rises up and turns to Sam, who is sullen an silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is shirtless on his back on the roof of the shack, sunning himself as George struggles to extricate a sofa f a doorjamb.  Guster is asleep on the grass, under a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?  I'm...for like three minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After another bout of trying, George drops the sofa and s back to glance up at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  If I break my back, daddy's gonna buy you a naval ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if that naval ring don't fit, daddy's gonna rub you down with the sun screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances down at his father, puzzled by the verse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you wearing sun block.  And I want you down here to help me.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam dismisses his father without a word - he simply adjus his face back to the sun.  George walks away.  A sudden s of water drenches Sam, forcing him to his feet in a cold panic.  George stops the hose water pelting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works on Guster.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: George is still struggling with the sofa stuck in the doo Frustrated, he steps away from the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in there not helping at all, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is leaning against a wall with his arms folded across chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what else helped Guster?  Neutering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slightest alarm crosses Sam's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shirtless in shorts, boiling pasta on a portabl stove as he heats a sauce in the microwave.  A dresser to with plyboard serves as a countertop; other than a sink b across the garage near the toilet, this is a fairly well equipped makeshift kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want garlic bread?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George waits a bit to make sure no response is no respons Then stuffs a hunk of garlic bread into the toaster oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is sitting on the edge of a cliff that drops twenty f to the ocean; Guster is whining for attention behind Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, get over here, then, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster inches forward on his belly, which makes Sam smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid of heights, Guster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drops to his belly and stretches out to pet Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fall probably wouldn't kill me, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster inches closer and licks Sam's face.  George walks with a tray filled with spaghetti, garlic bread and a Cok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking of jumping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sets the tray on the ground beside Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to the edge of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only jump after you hear the wave crash against the rock.  The water will take you out.  Let it.  Swim a little North and you'll see the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits up and faces his father with a trace of alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time I did it, younger than you, I thought I'd break my neck and just sort of float to Catalina. (beat) You don't always get what you wish for, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George suddenly leaps forward and disappears into the sea a wave crashes against the rocks below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam scurries to his feet and scans the ocean for his fath the only thing visible is darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster is lapping up the dinner, bread and all as Sam cal out again.  In a bit of a panic, Sam runs from the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic is heavy as Sam runs against it.  Without a sidewalk and with parked cars blocking a reasonable path, this is a dangerous trek North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs to the edge of the water and anxiously waits for father to emerge from the sea.  A jogger startles Sam - h steps into a wave that soaks his shoes.  George floats on wave into view and stands in waist high water, only to be knocked way back down.  He rises and falls and rises befo making his way to the sand and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you totally insane?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost saw Catalina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George coughs and drops onto the sand exhausted.  Sam sto off, angry that he cared enough to get angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is winded as he walks off the street to the middle of yard.  He glances around for Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster bounces out of the garage with spaghetti sauce covering his muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so busted, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits down on the grass and plays with Guster, who yap with joy as he breaks away and closes the distance with t abandon of a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my dinner, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam manages to pin Guster on his back.  He looms over the as he kisses him on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry!  Where's my dinner?  Who ate my dinner?  Huh?  Who's in trouble now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rolls over Guster and stands, nearly stumbling in the process - way uncool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster bumps against Alyssa for her attention; she kneels down to pet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to make me spend the summer here.  I'm leaving in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to be in Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad's really gonna build his house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you don't go, I guess I'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa stands.  Sam is clearly shy around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumped into the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I said "hi".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa pets Guster again before walking away.  Sam is smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's curled up in a tattered lazy-boy near the toilet, watching television as George sits on the bed, brushing h teeth.  Suddenly, Sam turns to face his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking a dump with you in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods as he continues brushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers say it's the worst smell they've ever smelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods again, which appears only to irritate Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have to have a door between where you cook and where you crap.  Like even in the bush, tribal people and like that have a place for both.  It's like a law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks around Sam to the sink and spits, rinses and wipes his mouth with a towel.  He faces Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which side of the bed do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's jaw drops as he glances at the double-bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding.  The sofa's a pullout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George smiles and pats Sam on the shoulder before walking the sofa and pulling it out to make a bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably in the bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George drops his pants and climbs into bed.  He pulls the sheet up and fluffs the pillow before resting his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to take a dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George twists around in bed to face Sam.  After a beat, h tosses the sheet back, climbs out of bed, pulls back on h pants, slips on his shoes and walks out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is up on the roof, hacking through the shingles an beams with a chain saw.  A huge dumpster set on the lawn receives only about half the throws George makes.  Sam is near the ocean in a chaise lounge, listening to music thr his portable CD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got sunscreen on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no chance he's been heard.  TOM and BARBARA, two older neighbors of George's nearing home from a walk, sto the driveway - both look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time this shack is torn down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara appears surprised as George turns to face them - obviously didn't realize he was the one up on the roof do the demolition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess how many low-income apartments the city approved for this lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Barbara react by trying not to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...ballpark figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Barbara step back and walk away.  George heads to ladder and climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Sam is grooving to the music with his eyes closed as Geor hand, filled with a gob of sunscreen, plops onto Sam's stomach.  Sam bolts up from the chaise lounge in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!  You can't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you stayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks across her lawn to the feuding family.  Geor holds out the bottle of sun lotion to Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rub him down, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks back to the ladder and up onto the roof as Alyssa and Sam stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look better without make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even take a shower here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over to my house whenever you want.  I'll tell my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might not stay, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches out for the lotion, but Alyssa hides the bott

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had anyone but your mom or dad put it on for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam thinks about it for a second before shaking his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird how different it is.  Lay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is back with the chain saw, hacking away at the ro Sam is hesitant as he lies down on his stomach.  Alyssa kneels and squeezes lotion on his back.  She works it in, starting at his neck, working her way down to his pants. squirts Sam's arm and as she rubs close to his pit, he squirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me from when you lived here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad dated my mom after her divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted him to marry her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa grabs under his armpits and tickles him.  Sam yelp and rises onto his elbows as Josh roars by the shack in h Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and I are going to South Coast.  Wanna ride?  Maybe see a movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is disappointed as Alyssa stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks to the shack and waves goodbye to George.  George waves her off.  Sam curls onto his side as he watc Alyssa run across the lawn to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty...for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears irritated as he stands and walks into the gar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances out the window to check on his father, then quickly rummages through every drawer and cabinet looking what he finds: a prescription bottle.  It's Vicodin.  He checks on his dad through the window again, then opens th bottle and takes out five pills.  He fills a glass with w and swallows two, saving three for later.  He sets the bo back where he found it before he drops on the bed with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster is in a full out run for a rubber ball.  Sam is shirted, sitting at the patio table.  With the ball gladl returned, Sam tosses it again.  George walks out juggling plates of sandwiches and two Cokes and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever get like the slightest inkling that you might want to help me instead of doing absolutely nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the inkling, Sam.  I'm getting tired of your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam picks up the sandwich, examines it and sets it back d on the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes a bite of his sandwich before responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to take out your nose ring and leave it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bugs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You snore at night.  That bugs me.  Can I take you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brothers are right.  It was the most god-awful smell I've ever had my nose around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George tightens his face and waves his hand in front of h nose.  Sam stares at his father.  A black Range Rover pul to a stop and Robin steps out with a pizza box in her han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you guys might be hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Robin walks up the drive, Sam picks up the turkey sand and starts eating.  George glances at Sam as Robin sets t box on the table and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.  Turkey sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for later then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin focuses on the nearly roofless shack.  Guster walks the table and sits down by Robin, ready to beg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you hated four out of the five you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here six years.  And I only hated two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first and the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sets his sandwich down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even like turkey sandwiches.  What kind of pizza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George opens the box and pulls out a slice.  Sam appears disinterested as George starts in on the slice of pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Sure you don't want any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs off his mother, looking away.  Robin nods and grabs a piece for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too thin, George.  From what you used to be, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George responds with a pleasant face; he's not going to explain his weight loss right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the first and the last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin sets her slice of pizza down as she studies George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
