dialogues.text: The first because I wasn't sure you really loved me...the last because I wasn't sure I really loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods.  Though it may appear that Sam isn't interes in the conversation, his ears are perked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was up on the roof this morning, tearing it down and it struck me as strong as anything ever has.  That I'm happy today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been before today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just that, maybe the way the sun struck the ocean, the sound of the waves.  It was simple, whatever it was.  Then I started thinking about the last time I felt this good. (beat) It's been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only time I can think of for sure, I was holding onto Sam in the ocean, saving him from the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George turns to Sam, who's caught staring at his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You head was pressed against my chest.  I could feel your heart racing.  And I remember I kissed your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have it on video!  Was that when?  My parents were down for his sixth birthday!  I remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin inexplicably starts to cry.  She instantly tries to take it back, pressing her hand to her mouth, wiping her eyes, but whatever emotion has her, has her good.  Both George and Sam are confused and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and backs away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  Nothing. (beat) I'll drop by your lunch tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin wipes her eyes again as she climbs into her car and drives off.  Sam and George face one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take a walk.  I need some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have money when you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so predictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sets his sandwich down and grabs a slice of pizza as stands.  He walks for a few feet, stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been happy in ten years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't wait for an answer; as he walks away, Guster follows.  George takes Robin's slice of pizza and drops i the cement; that's all it takes to turn Guster around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is sitting alone at the table, doing nothing.  The is on loud in another room.  Adam walks into the room in pajamas.  He sits down across from his mother at the tabl Robin smiles at him.  He smiles back as he scoots his cha closer to the table and extends his arms straight out acr the top.  Robin extends her arms and they lock hands near middle.  Without a word, they hold hands.  Adam lets go a climbs on top of the table, scoots across it with a kiss his mother before he's gone, sliding off the table on his rear and running back to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is on the patio, bending a thin piece of copper tubing.  Sam storms out of the garage, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one would blame me if I left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd blame you.  I want you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just beg some money off my dad and move into something decent with a real kitchen and a real bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather sell my nuts to a castrati.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam screws his face down - huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't beg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't take a shower in the middle of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can promise you complete privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't promise me anything!  You don't have anything to promise!  You live in a garage!  You don't have cable!  You're not hooked up to the internet because you don't even own a computer!  You don't have a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George finishes bending the copper into a circle.  He sta and holds the copper circle out for proof of privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will save you from prying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam dismisses his father with a shake of his head.  He he back into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam quickly heads to where George's prescription bottle w hidden under a pile of underwear.  He steals two more pil and swallows them before grabbing a towel and walking out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had a stupid phone or I could use your truck, mom would give me some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have money when you work for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stomps down the driveway and across the grass to Alys house.  George walks around to the back of his garage wit the rounded copper tubing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is standing on the porch with his towel and clean clothes.  Colleen answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Alyssa home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...do you know when she'll be home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't really say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods and steps back as he prepares to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't recognize you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa said you don't even have plumbing over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen takes Sam by the arm and nudges him into the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is slowly making his way around the room, taking note everything: some dried flowers; a yearbook; a cabinet ful CD's; dirty clothes stuffed in a hamper.  He walks into t bathroom before walking back out and making one more roun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is sitting between her sons on the sofa, watching a movie.  Peter enters the room, carrying his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn traffic.  Were we going out to dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin focuses on her husband, but the boys are riveted to television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Lois still here?  I'm starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands as Adam and Ryan try to hold her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did someone call to tell you I'd be late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks into the kitchen without responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's in the shower, obscured by the sandblasted glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro, I need you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bumps an elbow against the glass as he opens the show door enough to look out.  Josh is sitting up on the marbl countertop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I locked the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh holds up a tiny screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take you like twenty, thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Alyssa know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any weed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam waits a beat before closing the shower door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sent me up to see if you wanted to hang around and watch a movie with her and her mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The round copper tube is braced and nailed to the side of garage; on it hangs a shower curtain.  George is making noises inside the curtain as he showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  Oh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there's an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George pulls back the shower curtains just enough to see standing by in his police uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hot water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shivering as he closes the curtain back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dokos called to complain that you and a boy are squatting illegally in the garage of your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the permits.  It was built as a guesthouse.  It's a legally rentable unit grandfathered when South Laguna was incorporated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, the copper tubing holding the hanging curtain falls to the ground.  George turns the water off grabs a towel.  Unfortunately, his ass is not what the to covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that should be illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa and Colleen are curled up on the sofa as Josh and stick their heads in to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you both to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And candy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa holds up a huge bowl of popcorn and the DVD case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give him a ride in my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over anytime you need to, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I'd like that.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing keeping Sam from staying is Josh, who jerk him out by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Kurt in the only chair, George hands him a cup of co and sits down on the pullout sofa, which is pulled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised he hasn't left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't forced him to work.  I only wet him down once.  Why would he leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes in and grabs a sweater before starting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops at the door and waits impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, until you know, you can't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is gone in a flash.  Kurt studies George for a second

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not very good at it.  Parenting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt nods; agreed, he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin arranges an attractive plate of food, which she sti in the microwave.  Peter walks in wearing different cloth but the same personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your ex-husband is equipped for the havoc of Sam, because it seems absolutely blissful here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down at the table, opening up a newspaper as Robi stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's odd your kids don't hug you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would worry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter glances up from the paper, focusing on Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I let everything that should worry me, worry me, I'd be dead from worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you be if you asked Adam and Ryan to run in now and hug you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer bothers Robin enough that Peter can't concentr back on the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it if that's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks out of the kitchen.  Peter folds the paper an shoves it across the granite counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Josh are parked on a street that overlooks the Va East of Laguna Beach.  They share a joint as Josh explain the specifics of the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do a thing.  Just get in and get out.  As quick as you can.  Close your eyes and think of whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hands the joint to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your deal with Alyssa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even...I'm there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't even fucking go out with until she was sixteen.  I mean, that's not even a rule, just her own thing.  She like figures things out on her own and then that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black Mercedes Benz pulls to a stop a ways down the str Josh hands Sam a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this rings, run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is scared and it shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already knows everything about what he can't do.  You can tell him not to even look at you, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking it's too weird now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh pulls a baggie of grass and holds it out for Sam, wh takes it and stuffs it in his pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh hands Sam the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inhale and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is quick to inhale, but slow to get out.  Josh takes joint and Sam steps out.  He walks slowly to the Mercedes opens the door and climbs in.  Josh turns the CD on to Guster's "ALL THE WAY UP TO HEAVEN."  Sam closes the door the Mercedes.  'He said to only look up, he said to never look down, down is where we came from...' It's an odd son sung in a happy tempo; a whistling refrain overtakes the lyrics as Josh inhales.  'He said to hope for the best an take a load off my chest.  Soon, I could be happy, and go the way up to heaven and go all the way back home.'  With the music loud, Josh misses the police car as it sto behind him without the lights.  Too late for a getaway, h fumbles for his cell phone and tosses the joint out the o window.  The OFFICER approaches the Porsche with his hand his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you toss into the brush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh furtively presses send on his cell phone as he faces officer with a guilty face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'He said I might need his help, no one gets high on themselves.  I just seem so lonely; he's just trying to b nice and spread around his advice.  I could be happy...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off the music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the music stops, the door to the Mercedes opens and Sa hops out with his pants around his ankles.  The officer notices and walks towards the Mercedes.  The parking ligh flash red as the car starts and flees the scene.  Sam yan up his pants and leaps down the hillside, falling and rol in the brush as the officer yells for him to stop.  Josh starts his car, but the officer dissuades him from leavin removing his gun.  Josh turns off the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's working now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you toss into the brush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Josh can feign innocence again, the brush starts t smolder.  Busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is spotted with weeds and dirt as he continues his wa down the steep hillside holding up his pants.  After he's sure he's safe, he sits down and rests his head in his ha He starts to shake, frightened by his actions.  He drops his back, buttons and zips his pants as he starts to cry. Slowly, he stops crying, but keeps staring up at the sky, which is loaded with stars and a full moon.  Mesmerized b the brilliant night, Sam can't stop staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is removing the last of the windows, carefully pry it out of the casement as Robin pulls up in her Range Rov She steps out dressed in Levi's, boots and a t-shirt, carrying a large bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and walks toward George, dropping the food sac the patio table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not breakfast yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamed about your house last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished or unfinished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was perfect, George.  Amazing.  It was so real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you once dream you could lick people well, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't a dream.  That was Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...with his ear infection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tongue around the edge of his ear is what cured him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George isn't quite sure how to take her comment.  Finally points to the Garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in there and lick his attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antibiotics weren't working. (beat) It's what I believe, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George stares at Robin for a second before he nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wrong about the first year, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Robin a second to understand he's saying he love her when they married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been wrong a lot in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hindsight.  It's like foresight without a future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin almost smiles; George confessing love ten years dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have three hours before I pick up Adam and Ryan. (beat) Where will I be most useful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin glances around, assessing the best use of her time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your hands or your tongue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin picks up a pile of splintered board and tosses them the garbage bin.  George nods...he's not.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Robin and George carry a twelve-foot beam from inside the shack and set it down on cinder blocks.  Both look exhaus as they head back in for another beam.  Sam saunters out the garage in shorts, sits down on the patio chair and op the sack his mother had packed for lunch.  He pulls out a peanut butter and jelly sandwich and starts eating as Geo and Robin emerge from the shack with another beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin and George set the beam down and turn to Sam as the both wipe sweat off their faces.  Sam chews his sandwich, ignoring them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks close to Sam, trying to capture his attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan has a game later.  He asked if you'd come and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances up at his mother, just long enough to let her know he hates her, then drops the sandwich and walks back into the garage.  A city inspector's car pulls to a stop the street and BOB LARSON steps out with a clipboard.  Ro passes him as she walks back to her Range Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dreading you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and George shake hands as Robin drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Larson.  Do you happen to have an unenclosed toilet in close proximity to a kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I enclosed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exhaust system or a window is code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allowed outside the enclosed area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks out of the garage in long pants and a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of yours is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you got through my pants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George grabs his chain saw and walks to the garage with S and Bob in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you put it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to an armoire and empties it.  He grabs a ha and bangs, pries and pulls the back off, then dumps the cabinet onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you took it.  I want it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George yanks the chain saw to a roar and fashions an oval a few feet deep on the cabinet base.  He kills the saw, l the armoire and scoots it in front of the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob grimaces as George opens the armoire, revealing the toilet inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to ask about a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) I flushed it down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George jerk starts the chain saw again and fashions a sma opening above the toilet, ripping through the studs, wire mesh, tar paper and stucco - fine dust invades the space a storm.  Bob coughs as he writes in his book.  George ki the chain saw and sets it down as he surveys his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a gun, I'd kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob seems fairly anxious to conclude his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you'll fill the...uh, window, with glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in my pants is none of your fucking business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little rattled) I would say you're in compliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that makes the pain in the ass that called you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is staring at Sam.  Bob backs out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Bob gone, George walks to Sam and gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything about you is my business.  What you smoke, what you swallow, what you sniff, it's all my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slams his fists against his own chest, maddened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been using since I was twelve!  You're all so unbelievably stupid.  You didn't give a shit about anything I did until now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll apologize for everything but today...Today I give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too fucking late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloves on the table are for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make me do a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George gently guides Sam back onto the bed.  Sam hops up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the cops if you touch me again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sets Sam back onto the bed, not so gently this tim Sam is less eager to hop up in defiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're in the big shit now!  Child abuse.  People go to prison for what you just did to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad used to play a game.  I never really understood what it was until after he was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears immensely disinterested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was holding for someone.  That wasn't even mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game was to make me smaller than he was.  No matter what.  He could be almost invisible as a human being, but I had to be smaller.  So if I got good grades, I was a pussy for not playing football.  If I cut my hair for him, it wasn't short enough.  If I shaved it, I looked like a psycho.  I never won the game.  Not once.  And if he couldn't make me smaller with words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well in George's eyes.  Sam is caught up enough in his father has to say that he has to feign his lack of interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to pay him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ever hit you. (beat) I don't want you smaller.  I want you to be happy.  You're not.  Not here with me.  Not home with your mother.  Not up in Tahoe.  Not alone.  Not anywhere. (beat) You're what I was most of my life, Sam.  I see it in your eyes.  In your sleep.  In your answer to everything.  You're barely alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that great thing, though?  Is that change can be so constant you don't even feel the difference until there is one.  It can be so slow that you don't even notice that your life is better or worse, until it is. (beat) Or it can just blow you away.  Make you something different in an instant.  It happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to the garage door as he wipes his eyes.  He stops and turns back around to face Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Build this house with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks out leaving Sam on the bed to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George gathers a pile of splintered boards and tosses the into the dumpster.  He works while Guster sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The sun is fierce, low on the horizon with a heat that distorts the distance.  George is sweating and shirtless Sam walks out of the garage with the gloves on and stands staring at his father.  After a beat, George notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pay back what you flushed down the toilet. (beat) I want ten dollars an hour...then I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods.  He points out the roofless shell of a shack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all has to come down before we can start again. (beat) Knock it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George picks up a sledghammer and hands it to Sam.  Sam hoists the hefty hammer and with some true effort, slams on a sideboard.  He slams again and again as George picks a slightly smaller sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hated this house from the second my father cheated everyone and put it in my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes a good hard whack at the wall, knocking a hu hunk of it down.  Sam stops to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years of hating what you live in...what you are.  This is the end of it, Sam.  I'm gonna build something of me here that I can be proud to give to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George YELLS as he lands the hammer into the wall again. is alarmed by his father's blatant rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do whatever you want with it.  I don't care.  All I want from you is for you to remember we built this house together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't build shit.  You're just tearing down your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it.  It feels good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George strikes another blow to the house joined with a MA WAIL.  Sam starts low, a whisper of a scream, but quickly builds, soon rivaling George in volume as he pounds away. This soul letting, cleansing ritual is both impelling and frightening to watch.  Tom and Barbara, Colleen and her m step out of their houses, drawn and perplexed by the gutt noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both boys are asleep as Robin enters and wakes them with drop-and-bounce-back-to-your-feet-from-the-mattress metho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's morning, sleepyheads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both wake with a groan.  Robin leaps onto Adam and tickles him to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is quickly finishing a breakfast of oatmeal and fre fruit with Adam and Ryan, who are still dressed in pajama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we have to get up and eat with you this early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought it would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to see Sam again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might stop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All day again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all day.  I'll be home after lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands and dumps her dishes in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go back to bed...or Lois might let you go swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be with you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey.  There's not much to do there.  I mean, it's all work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin focuses on her sons, both of whom seem willing to w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, would you rather swim or work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we really help build a house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks in, surprised by everyone being up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is everyone up so early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is knocking away the forms used to pour the foundation.  Sam walks out of the garage with a towel; he shields his eyes from the morning sun as he watches his father work.  Without make-up or a nose ring and with the black dye gone from his hair and the polish from his nail Sam is a handsome kid.  George looks happy, laying bare the foundation that will his home.  Sam walks to Alyssa's house, unseen by his fat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is walking with Sam toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's not up, you can use my shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here early today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting out of the ground today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks fairly excited as he rushes up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops at the door and KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can use your mom's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is curled up in bed, cuddling a stuffed bear as Sa walks in and closes the bedroom door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with Josh when the cops arrested him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sits up in bed, holding the sheet to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Not really.  No.  Kinda.  He got busted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents took his car.  They're making him ride a bicycle the rest of the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam can't help but like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to tell you that you owe him a hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can peddle over anytime he wants to for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam breaks into a full-on smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious!  I don't have my license.  He was my ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just here to shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks into the bathroom; before he closes the door, h faces Alyssa with another smile - she tosses her bear at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is prying off the last of the boards when he's hit with a pain that takes him to his knees.  He drops the crowbar and sits down in the dirt as Guster walks over to comfort him.  George takes deep breaths and closes his ey as he tries to gain control over the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorknob jiggles, jiggles and turns; Alyssa opens the door and walks in dressed in a t-shirt and panties.  Once again Sam jumps and jams his elbow to the frosted glass a partially opens the shower door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this like a past time with people?  Go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sets a tiny screwdriver on the vanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen lots of people.  It's not a big thing for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me a towel.  I'm getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so uptight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even...what do you mean?  I don't even know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I'm gonna shampoo my hair and stay out of your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me a towel.  Hand me a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is anxious.  Alyssa takes off her t-shirt and pulls d her panties before grabbing a towel; she hands it to Sam she forces her way into the shower.  Barely visible throu the frosted glass, Alyssa wets her hair as Sam stares in direction.  The towel drops to the tiled floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is curled up in bed, the prescription bottle and a glass resting on a table.  He's holding onto his side, st in some pain.  A HONK gets Guster BARKING outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Adam run to Guster with glee as Robin steps out the Range Rover with a large covered basket and a boom bo She sets the basket and radio on the patio table and sear for George, ending up at the entrance to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George has hidden the prescription bottle and is sitting the bed as Robin walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be up with the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stupid back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin sits down on the bed next to George, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything?  I'll go to the pharmacy.  I have some Demerol at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm...thanks.  I took something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin runs her hand down George's spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't use my shower.  I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Adam and Ryan are each calling Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought your kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of said that maybe they could do something.  Help.  I'm sorry.  They really wanted to come.  I really wanted to come and they wanted to be with me.  I don't think they'll be too much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find something that won't kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or wound.  Let them keep their eyes and fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin smiles.  With some effort, George stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands and wraps her arm around his waist and he dr his arms over her shoulder as they walk out of the garage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up this morning at three and couldn't fall back asleep.  Everyday I think I see more of Sam than I've seen in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam runs with abandon to Sam and Alyssa as Robin helps George to a patio chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam runs into Sam with a hug, then steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom said I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears awkward as he rests his hand for a second on Adam's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam views her suspiciously as they walk across Alyssa's grass to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom says we can build a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear that Robin is falling in love with her son aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa extends her hand to Robin and they shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so nice to let Sam use your shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a standing invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam instantly flushes red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks to Ryan, who's been standing back from the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drapes his arm over Ryan's shoulder and together they walk to the foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you wanna build a house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we do, will it stay up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINK 182 SONG BLASTS from the boom box on the patio ta Ryan and Adam slather paint remover on five old painted doors.  They work with gloves and brushes and appear meticulous in their application.  Alyssa and Sam nail and bolt the corner posts to the rim joist as Robin and Georg work on the stick framed door deck.  While George is moving a little slower than usual, it app that the pain is nearly gone.  As the song ends, Robin ru toward the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought a few of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin runs to her car and retrieves a few CD's.  She slip the CD in and we HEAR John Hiat's "DISTANCE."  It's a slo soft song that brings a smile to George's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my very first slow dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know him before you knew Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since seventh grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him how you made me fall in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smiled at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for the smile, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin's body moves slightly to the music as she smiles.  George grins.  The boys aren't sure what to make of the advice.  'You are the beautiful love (my lover), I am the distant shore (so far away).  There is so much to uncover (love's hiding).  What is this distance for?  What is it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's up for a dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin glances around for any takers, finally focusing on George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't hug me too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks to his mother and they hold hands as they danc Sam sits down to watch.  George wears a smile that wipes last of the pain from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you get.  I'm busy today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam backs away and grabs his paintbrush.  Robin stops dancing as she focuses on George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if you've gotten any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm worse.  Much, much worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin waits to see how worse.  George finally walks to he and takes her in his arms.  He must have been better than this.  The waltz smooths out as they dance closer, holdin tighter.  "We fill the air with silent stares.  But still one there, we are strangers."  Alyssa decides it's time t go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watches Alyssa walk away, but he's quickly drawn back his mother and father dancing.  Ryan appears anxious, uns of the music and George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you fall in love with my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance stops.  George lets go of Robin as she focuses Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I found out I was pregnant with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is on the pull out bed, listening to music through he phones.  We HEAR a flush, the armoire doors open and Geor walks out of the cabinet, washes his hands, turns off the light and drops into bed.  A nightlight stuck in a socket above the bed casts a dull blue light over the room.  Sam takes the headphones off.  After a long silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took some of your Vicodin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like how it feels not to feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George turns onto his side to face his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you become something you're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's the thing...I am what I say I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know parts of who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George drops back onto his back.  He takes his time to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you started first grade and your mom went to work, it was so she could save for an apartment.  But then she met Peter and skipped the idea of renting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't imagine how I could compete with him for any part of you.  So, I didn't.  He wanted you to have his last name...I let him even take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a prick when I was six, and he's a prick today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George turns onto his side to face Sam again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you had told me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave up on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be in Tahoe having fun if you had given up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you be doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting high, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I asked you to stop, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't used anything for two days.  I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.  And hide whatever that new drug is you have.  I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns away from his father and puts his headphones on The music bleeds through the headphones in a muffled rumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put a gun to my father's head once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's voice is soft - there's no chance Sam can hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought like that?  I've been thinking...watching you work.  How much do you hate me? (beat) He was passed out.  Just screaming at my mother before.  About nothing.  Under-cooked meat.  I went back to my room... put the barrel close to his ear and chickened out again.  Not my dad.  Hid in my room.  Not even me. (beat) Of course it was a BB gun.  But it still would have hurt like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam notices his father's mouth moving and takes off the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking about my mom.  She wouldn't leave him.  I remember one time she made us dinner wearing sunglasses.  I mean it was dark outside and in.  But we never talked about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hide a black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't she leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she was terrified of living with him...but maybe even more terrified of life without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything would have been better if you had.  You'd have liked your grandmother.  And there'd be a girl out there that'd have her mother.  I remember reading about her in the paper.  They couldn't find her father and her mother was dead.  I still feel guilty about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever wish you had done it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George thinks about that for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After everything he did to you and your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so weird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slips his headphones back on.  George nods...it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster is squatting on the lush lawn of the mansion takin dump.  David bursts out from his house, rushes to his bla Mercedes and tries once again to run over Guster.  No suc luck.  Guster moves on to another lawn as Mr. Dokos drops over the curb and drives off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the late June afternoon, with a clotted cloud sky, Rob Adam, Ryan, Sam, Alyssa and George work at building a hou Adam and Ryan are staining the interior doors they stripp days earlier.  George and Sam carry large wood beam to th foundation and slip it into the pocket mortise of the laminated beam that spans from pier post to pier post.  R grabs a drill and screws the cast-in tie down to the wood beam.  Alyssa is sawing a rafter in half as her mother wa across the grass with a huge basket of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone hungry?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: With MUSIC playing in the background, everyone is packed around the patio table eating pasta and drinking lemonade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the color I'm making the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The absolute best color I've ever seen in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lights up, pleased to be praised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bedrooms will your house have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Sam live with you or us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a quick response that draws Robin's attention.  Sam lightly bops Adam on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So put your plans of my room in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Dad wants you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, that's not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stop being ridiculous?  Your father wants Sam home as much as I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts laughing.  George smiles.  Sam can't stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't meant to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and George stand at exactly the same time and walk ba to the house.  Without a word, they work together as they continue to frame the house.  Suddenly George turns back the pack of people at the table and loudly proclaims:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  He goes back to work as Sam glances at him, amused.  Adam and Ryan are surprised and it shows on thei faces.  Robin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin's in bed reading as Peter emerges from the bathroom pajama bottoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I've decided?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin glances up from her book to Peter's hairy chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To shave your chest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should take a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs his pajama top and slips it on as he climbs i bed.  Robin sets her book down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest waste of time since television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember anything I've said that wasn't negative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin takes long enough to think that Peter forges on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Robin a few seconds to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to drive through New England in the Fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner than the Fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes in on her, kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the kids are back in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois will stay with them.  Or we can pawn them off on your parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of reasonable excuses, Robin opts for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm helping George build his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been helping for the last few days.  Weeks.  Sam's working.  I told you Sam was working.  I mean, he really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  That was the plan.  We couldn't stand him and George needed help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As true as it is, this still irritates Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go because of Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't been away together for three years.  What difference does a few months make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go with me because of Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is working at something for the first time in his life.  Once in a while he even talks to me.  I want to be around for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I, Robin.  I'm working at something, too.  I'm even talking.  Do you want to be around for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is intense, close up, not giving her breathing room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin whispers her answer.  Peter pulls away and settles on his back.  Robin doesn't move for the longest time.  Finally, she eases onto her back and turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about our marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence finishes the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an extended plate and overhung rafters, the frame ta its form; rooms are roughed in; windows are framed; two g dormers distinguish the common-rafter roof in the front a frame for a balcony juts out over the ocean in back.  Rob and Adam are locking in and hoisting the sheets of plywoo a pulley system up to Ryan and George, who are stripped d to shorts - George is thinner than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is showering as Alyssa walks in from the bedroom and joins him; no protest is voiced this time around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa smiles at Sam as she grabs a wash cloth and slathe it with liquid soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does everything have to have a point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's freakish.  I don't get it.  I'm not really supposed to touch you, but I can look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa faces Sam as she washes her body with the cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're totally into guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances down at himself; Alyssa looks too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're driving me crazy!  Do you know what it's like trying to jack-off in an armoire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're off, you know?  You're way, way off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was helping you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would help me if I could kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't...NO.  I thought we were just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think, you know, doesn't have much to do with reality.  I mean, I hope I'm not the first to say that about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but then we'll just be friends.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands still, unsure of his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever even kissed a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears shocked she would even ask; he hasn't, but sh not supposed to know that.  Alyssa makes the move, closes distance and kisses him.  Apart, it appears to be somethi they enjoyed.  Sam wraps his arms around her, presses him against her and kisses her again.  After a few seconds of making out, Sam jerks once, then a as he backs away.  Alyssa grimaces as she glances down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa steps into a corner of the shower as Sam turns aro and rests his forehead on the tile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scrubbing the shower down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Sam are on ladders, reinforcing a window openi on the second floor with a 2x4 spline.  Ryan and Adam are flat on their backs on the grass with Guster between them dog-tired.  Robin is at the grill with hamburgers as Alys prepares the table for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have a really great husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin glances up at Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, I mean, well, you're here every single day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at work while I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'd just be jealous if I were him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he doesn't need to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my kids and my wife were always at an ex-husband's house, I'd worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not the type to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is slightly pissed at Alyssa grilling her; she flip the hamburgers and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music is playing softly in the background.  Peter is sitt alone in a chair with a drink in hand.  After a bit, Lois walks in holding a can of Pledge and a rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be glad to fix you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois nods and walks away.  For all the presence of the ro Peter looks small and frayed in it - lost in his own hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch is over.  Adam is wrestling with Guster on the lawn Robin is taking money from her purse as George hands Sam keys to his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing R, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough for drinks, popcorn and candy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And video games after!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home after. (to Sam) Will you come in and say "hi"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs, takes the money and keys as Ryan and Adam rus close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to take her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three boys turn to watch as Alyssa, now dressed in a dress, walks across the lawn to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's literally frightening how beautiful Alyssa can look; with her tan and white dress, Sam shutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is peddling down the highway on his bike, sweating i the full afternoon sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is hewing a beam as Robin watches from a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George stops and wipes the sweat from his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you shouldn't come everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Why?  I like to be with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that there's less that Adam and Ryan can do anymore. (beat) I'd hate to have them bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands and walks to George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they're not much help, but they love coming here, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do they get to spend with their dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with this?  They wouldn't spend less time with Peter if they lived here!  He has no time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks away, then back - she's frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Alyssa thinks something is up with us?  She's giving me crap about being away from Peter and now you're trying to do the same thing!  What no one seems to realize is that Peter isn't there!  He's not there!  And when he is, he isn't! (beat) So, if you don't want me here, or you don't want my kids here, just tell me, George.  I'll stop coming.  But it won't be because of Peter.  It'll be because you asked me to stop.  Say what you need to say, because I'm not leaving until I hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather you not be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, on the street, Josh peddles past on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hire workers to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin nods, gathers her things, walks to her car, climbs and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is standing in the entry, talking to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come in and wait if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends did she go with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin pulls right back to where she was parked and parks again.  She steps out of the car talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is going on with us, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I picked you up from the train station...what you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing about I was the most, you know, beautiful person you had ever known.  What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never said that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say a lot of things I've never said before.  It's habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like a pick-up line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin sits down, weighted by the reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bit my finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I weren't married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George wants to answer quickly, dismiss the impossible an move on, but emotion catches him off-guard.  He forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not do this, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to know what?  Do I still love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is surprised by the question.  She nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  There's not a doubt in my mind that through all my anger...my ego, I was faithful in my love for you.  From seventh grade on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin raises her eyebrows - what a revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I made you doubt it, that I withheld it...that's the greatest mistake of a life full of mistakes. (beat) But the truth doesn't set us free, Robin.  I can say it as many times as you can stand to hear it.  And all that does, the only thing, is remind us that love isn't enough.  Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well in Robin's eyes as she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods - she should.  Robin walks to her car, opens door; she faces George before climbing in.  George walks the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George rummages through his sock drawer.  Pulls out a fol sock and opens it - the prescription bottle drops to the floor.  He fills a glass and swallows three pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin opens the door and heads straight for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I am is what I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin jumps and searches for the voice.  Peter's sitting alone in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds pathetic, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always felt I could never marry you without first showing you what a fabulous life you cloud live despite me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin takes a few steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never really trusted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live a fabulous life, Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands and walks to her.  Robin doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam took them to a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter takes her hand and kisses her cheek before walking the hall.  Robin stands still, trying to assess the excha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bedroom we don't quite recognize, two people are in throes of making love under a silk white sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to tell whose voice that is - Robin's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is in bed, awakened by a KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell asleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks in, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's dropping Adam and Ryan off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is slightly out of it with oral morphine; he tires sit up, but settles for propping up his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you keep Sam straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not gay.  I found out purely by accident, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean drugs. (catching up) I thought you said he was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't use around me.  I don't like any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to ask you something, Mr. Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks over and lies on the bed beside George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to ask like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to try something with me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've taken a lot of morphine.  Oral morphine...for my back.  Can I wait till I can say no and sound convincing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa leans forward and kisses him; it's a real kiss tha lasts a lot longer than it should.  And when it's over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you feel anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your tongue...I don't know, my mouth is numb.  Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you dated my mom, I saw you kiss her once.  You looked like such a good kisser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the couple making love again; this time we're close enough to make out Colleen's face underneath Josh, who is working with speed, if not exact precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother would die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's shut up and not kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter has changed and is on the bed; his head propped up pillows; he stairs blankly at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is sitting alone in the living room, in the same sp Peter had been sitting earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa and George are still beside each other in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what I was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think it would be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (realizing) More like when I kissed Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and grabs his big toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa waves goodbye and leaves.  George is confused by i all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh looks as though he's been struck by a hammer as he l on his back with his mouth slack.  Under the sheet, low d Colleen is swallowing her pride and showing off her technique.  A sudden blaring noise, AN ALARM, pierces Jos throaty groan.  Colleen jumps off the bed, the sheet stil haunting her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  Get dressed!  Get dressed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa closes the French door she entered through and rus to the alarm panel as the siren blares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and Josh are frantically pulling on clothes as th noise throws them off balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the ALARM OFF, Alyssa walks to the entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh has pulled on his underwear backwards; only speed counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa glances around before heading up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a knock, Alyssa opens the door.  The room is empt but the bed is messed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks to the master bath, following the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is standing above Josh, who is bent over on his knees, with a plunger in the bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I completely forgot.  I'm so sorry, Josh. (beat) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh's face is flushed red and beaded with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put him to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a second for Colleen to realize that Alyssa is talking about the plumbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't get it to go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why was the alarm on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...I set it to see if it would work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better call and cancel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, we don't want the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is anxious as she rushes out.  Josh stands and wi the sweat from his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh fumbles and fidgets, finally finding a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal with you and Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is fixing dinner as we hear the front door open.  A is talking as he rushes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to play one video game for three hours straight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan enters right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you move to another one if the one you were playing made you look stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin checks the entry to the kitchen - no Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you get things right is to always try and never give up.  Huh, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it depends on what you give up on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin's face lights up as Sam walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were no PG's.  So I just gave them money to play games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stay for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on what I'd give up on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin opens the oven and shows Sam a platter of lasagna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin turns to Adam, excited at having Sam stay for dinne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go tell your father we're eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's home, already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam takes off in a run as Sam walks to the sink and wash his hands before grabbing a stack of plates for dinner. arranges the five on the table and then heads back for utensils as Adam runs back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here.  Check the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked everywhere.  He's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster's at the door, whining.  George and Sam are asleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is sitting alone at the kitchen table, drinking coffee as Alyssa walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up so early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to be mad at you, but I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is trembling as Alyssa pours herself a big bowl o Lucky Charms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...using Josh like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa eats her cereal as Colleen bursts into a confessio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never forgive myself.  Never, Alyssa.  I know I took advantage.  It's inexcusable.  Oh, God.  I should have my head examined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa looks confused as she swallows her Lucky Charms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you asked him to tighten your toilet seat, too.  That's so uncool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen quickly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do it again.  I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa keeps an eye on her mother as she continues on wit her cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster is taking a dump on the immaculate lawn.  David Do rushes from the house dressed in a suit and picks up the with a gloved hand and heaves it at Guster as the dog tro back to safety.  Tom and Barbara, the old early walkers o the street, stop and watch as David picks up more crap an tosses it onto George's driveway.  He notices Tom and Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
