dialogues.text: Mind your own fucking business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Barbara stay silent as David Dokos walks back int his house and slams the front door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is in eleventh gear on his ten speed peddling like a demon for the Beck's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin pulls to a stop and Ryan and Adam run from the Rang Rover to Sam and Alyssa, who are helping an ELECTRICIAN (DALE) install the outside boxes and sockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's disappeared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was there and then he wasn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam faces his mother as she walks toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin shakes her head "no" to Sam.  Dale turns to face Ad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the electrician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the builder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns back to finish what he was working on as Alyssa grabs Adam with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is swallowing two pills as Robin knocks on the hal open door, opening it all the way in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your back still killing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd come today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept thinking about it, what you said... I hope you were trying to keep me away fro the sake of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Mostly me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter left me yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No goodbye.  No fuck you.  No 'Are you in love with George?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I'll be in the bedroom.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin walks to George and holds on to his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't walk in there. (beat) So he left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rests the side of her head against his chest.  He kis her hair.  Outside, a hammer beats a reminder that they'r not alone.  The ocean drowns the sound long enough for Ro to kiss George's chin; and in that instant, the instant where everything but the touch washes away, George kisses Robin with such punch th it knocks them onto the bed.  They continue to forget everything as they roll with the punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, Dale needs to know..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops at the jamb of the open door as his mother and father scramble to their feet from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a kink in my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As George falters, Robin feels compelled to complete the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back.  Neck.  Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a quick confession) I don't know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't let Adam or Ryan see you doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Robin are flustered, embarrassed by being caug something Sam clearly relishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale wants to know if we should run an outside outlet for Christmas lights with a switch inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. (beat) Have him put it on a separate line.  At Christmas, we'll pact it so full of lights, we'll make God wear sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam laughs, grabs the door and closes it on his parents.  Robin slumps, truly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So could I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George touches Robin's chin, draws her head up.  He stare her, afraid to say what he needs to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to kiss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my back that's killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin furrows her brow, not understanding.  George surrou her head with his hands and kisses her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan are helping Dale run the electrical lines; Alyssa and Sam drill screws into the second story floorboards.  MUSIC is playing loud on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Josh stops peddling quite a distance from George's house gets off to search for Alyssa.  Only seeing Adam, Ryan an Dale, Josh pulls out his cell and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated and anxious, Colleen slips off the dress she's wearing and tries another one as the phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is standing behind a tree, talking on his cell phone he stares at George's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see her. (beat) Please just open the door when I knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips the phone back in his pocket, hops back on the b and makes a beeline toward Colleen's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busted, Josh has no choice but to join Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping...you could..you know.  Go for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa and Sam are leaning out the framed second story window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the handlebars or your shoulders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid of heights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks away from the window and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help us out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents cut my allowance off.  Without a car, I'm totally screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is paying Sam ten dollars an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sticks his head back out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I can get you three hundred cash for two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is fuming as he stares at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a joke.  A stupid joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns away from Josh.  George walks out the garage as wipes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, George!  I recruited some help for the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks to Josh and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam races to George with a hug - something unexpected. rushes back to work as George breaks into a smile.  Alyss rushes down the stairs and straight into George's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is still smiling as he tucks a strand of Alyssa's behind her ear.  Ryan sort of saunters over to George wit his hands sunk deep in his pockets.  Without asking, Geor wraps his arms around Ryan with a hug.  Afterward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to know where Mom was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs to be alone, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Dad left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little sad, is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even care if he ever comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan walks back to Adam, who's been standing still, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, you look like you could use a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I'm okay.  I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is too quick with his hug.  Josh is stiff as a boa Sam looks pissed as he walks away from the second story window and resumes screwing the floorboards.  George sets eyes on Dale as he opens his arms wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George walks toward Dale with his arms still extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they got me started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, I'll use these wires and shock you so bad your tongue will turn black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan are excited as George closes the distance.  Finally, Dale drops the harmless wire and takes off in a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is pacing the kitchen in a silky dress we haven't seen before.  Finally, she grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is propped up on the chaise lounge next to the pat table where everyone has dropped their crap.  Sam and Jos are sheeting the roof with tarpaper.  Robin is still in t garage.  One of two cell phones on the table begins to RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you get it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is in the middle of wiring a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let mine ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George picks up the offender, unsure whose phone it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Where are you?  You're driving me crazy, waiting like this.  I want you in me now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nearly drops the phone; he sits up straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Colleen?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen sits down, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I..I..I.. George?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George holds the phone out and examines it for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it mine?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh trips, slips and slides off the roof to the ground b as Alyssa lets out a loud SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen tosses the receiver as though it were a ball on f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, including Robin, is circled around Josh, who is sprawled on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.  I'm fine.  Maybe I'll go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that bone sticking out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an idiot to have you up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance is HEARD approaching.  Colleen runs from her house - she's now dressed more appropriately in Levi's an blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard a scream!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could just stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh fell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen stops a few feet short and covers her mouth with trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he might have broken a leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance silences the siren as it turns onto the cul sac and stops in front of George's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, George and Sam are sitting at the patio table as R and Adam play catch with Guster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ribs, a finger, a leg, a bruised kidney and a mild concussion aren't bad considering he landed on brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Robin nor Sam attempts a response.  Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get the kids home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a perfect day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands.  George stands because Robin's standing.  Without warning, Robin begins to cry again.  Ryan and Ada stop playing ball.  Sam studies her before finally loweri his eyes.  With her kids looking on, George stands still, hesitant to comfort her.  There's a moment where all that there is, where the only thing seen or heard is Robin's p After an awkward amount of time, she wipes her eyes, wipe her nose, crosses around the table to Sam and kisses the of his head, then his cheek.  Without a word, she walks t her car and climbs in; Ryan and Adam quickly join her in car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is brushing his teeth, dribbling and foaming over only sink in the garage.  Sam is propped up in bed with Guster, dressed on top of the sheets, fingering through a stack of CD's.  He glances over at his father twice befor speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like shit, lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George spits and rinses, facing Sam as he wipes his mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look better than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Mom cares that much that my...that Peter left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seemed upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tries to look slightly less interested than he is by continuing to flip through the CD's.  George sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, do you need to have surgery on it or what?  Because those pills you're taking are for a lot of pain.  And you're going through them quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you taking them still?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I count them.  In a sock isn't new, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not easy for George; he fumbles a bit before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a problem with cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops flipping though the CD's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that means.  What kind of problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you here so we could have a few months together.  Maybe everything happens for a reason.  Something bad to force something good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks somewhat panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Are you dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not easy for George; he fumbles a bit before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a problem with cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops flipping through the CD's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that means.  What kind of problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you here so we could have a few months together.  Maybe everything happens for a reason.  Something bad to force something good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks somewhat panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Are you dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you told Mom today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam whacks the CD's off his stomach; they scatter across floor.  Guster scoots off the bed in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!  You knew you were dying from the start!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bounds out of bed in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all dying from the start. (beat) I just got picked for Advanced Placement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have lied to me if I thought I'd believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was all for your sake, wasn't it?  Having me here?  Trying to get me to like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never tried to get you to like me. (beat) I tried to get you to love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, congratulations!  You fucking pulled it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam storms out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen pulls a robe around her nightgown as the doorbell RINGS again and again.  She flips on a light and opens th door.  Sam backs away from the door as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Alyssa here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's midnight.  What's the matter, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  My dad's dying.  I really need to talk to Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is leaning over the upstairs railing.  Sam walks u the stairs as Colleen closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea lions romp on a rock offshore as gulls circle above. sun sheets the morning on the water that's blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is under the covers holding onto Sam, who is still dressed.  Both are asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is in bed in pain.  A prescription bottle is open beside him and pills are scattered on the sheet.  A KNOCK the door forces George to gather the pills and hide the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt the cop opens the door dressed in civilian clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my day off.  I thought I'd help with the plumbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) God, you look like crap, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to find someone for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen walks out her front door straight to her neighbor house.  After a bit of RINGING and a bit of waiting, Tom the walking Tom and Barbara) answers the door in a bathro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your son still own a company that builds houses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is wiring with Adam and Ryan helping.  Kurt, Robin a Colleen are setting up and sealing the plastic plumbing pipes.  Two new men (GREG and MIGUEL) are on the roof, finishing up where Josh fell down.  MUSIC is playing on t radio.  George is asleep on the chaise lounge.  Alyssa wa across the grass and stops to stare at George.  Tears wel her eyes.  Alyssa continues on to the house and walks up stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been asleep for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Sam okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't leave my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin accepts the answer.  Slowly, they all return to wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day is productive as we see the black drainpipes and copper water runs coming together like a maze.  The roof shingled and the wiring is nearly complete.  Whether awak asleep, George spends the day in the chaise lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city inspector's truck pulls to a stop and Bob Larsen s out with a clipboard and a concerned look on his face.  George is dozing on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a plumber, Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt finishes hooking in a plugged tee at a turn and stan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked every summer with my dad.  Check out what I've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not whether it's good or bad.  You know that.  It's whether your licensed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Kurt glances around at all his good work befo answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still renting that illegal non conforming studio under your house for a thousand a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob opens his clipboard and checks a number of items off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Looks good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's embarrassing.  That was too easy.  At least look around.  I really did do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't why I'm here, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George wakes up and quickly hones in on Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dreading you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks toward George as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens.  One of your neighbors is adamant your home has exceeded its approved height.  He's filed to have construction stopped immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's thirty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it is, we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George stands, he appears slightly shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the permit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After your last extension request and with Design Review and the Board of Adjustment and the appeals to the city council, was there an amended permit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the patio and one north-facing window... (suddenly realizing) And six inches to the height.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sits back down.  Everyone emerges from the house t join George and Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Dokos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you let your dog crap on his lawn, day after day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't let him.  He just loves to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll make you tear the entire roof off rather than give you any satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you won't be able to continue until this is settled.  You can always go back and file an appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would take weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, we'll be here working tomorrow and every day after until this house is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll call us again and then he'll call the police.  He has an attorney on retainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin turns and walks back into the house.  Colleen, Alys Adam and Ryan soon follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he hears a hammer, he'll have you arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin picks up the hammer and pounds a nail into a piece wallboard.  Dale, Miguel, Greg and Kurt walk back to the house and go back to work.  Bob glances at George who shr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is watching the news as Alyssa walks in to say goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he eaten anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa shakes her head "no" as Colleen flips on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be more comfortable if he slept in the guestroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be more comfortable if you hadn't slept with Josh.  And George would be more comfortable if he weren't dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is embarrassed Alyssa knows the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfort doesn't mean that much when just getting through the night is the goal, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa walks out.  Colleen curls up and hides clutching pillows on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shaking and sweating as he tries to crawl off t bed to his sock drawer.  Guster wakes up and hops off Sam bed to lick George on the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is in real pain as he drops to the floor on his ba He winces and cries out as he pushes himself forward with legs toward the dresser.  George suddenly stops pushing; legs slump flat on the concrete floor.  His eyes flutter as Guster continues to lick his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is dressed, combing through wet hair when the soun construction distracts her.  She opens her window and sti her head out.  Suddenly excited, she pulls her head back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is in bed as Alyssa speeds out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are like twenty people working on your dad's house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa bolts for the door, but stops short as she faces S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it were my father, I'd wanna spend every second with him I had left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam doesn't face her, doesn't even attempt to look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he tricked me into loving him, is what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd hate him for the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if what he left me was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa leaves, closing the door behind her.  Sam stays pu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen is talking to Tom and Barbara as they stand to th side of the house where a throng of men assemble the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulled this crew off a tract in Newport.  They're the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin pulls to a stop on the street and Adam and Ryan run to gawk at all the workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hired some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen glances back as Alyssa runs to join the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atonement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's still sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER VIEW
dialogues.text: Robin walks to the garage door and KNOCKS.  Guster barks. Robin KNOCKS again before opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster is beside George on the floor.  Robin rushes in an kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses her hand against George's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up...You're still warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's eyes flutter open.  Robin leans down and kisses on the cheek.  George focuses on Robin; he tries to speak stops, and tries again.  Finally, in a weak voice, we hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop licking me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa bursts into the house and rushes up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is sitting on the edge of the bed as Alyssa enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad's going to the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa holds out her hand as we HEAR the ambulance approa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked where you were!  He wants you with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is nearly pleading, frightened to move.  Alyssa walks out.  The siren stops.  The front door closes.  Sam sits still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is coming together incredibly fast with all the workers.  Tom and Barbara are supervising the crew.  Davi Dokos whips around the corner in his black Mercedes and p in his driveway, rushing over as he yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is built until the Board of Adjustment hears the appeal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is searching for George, finally settling for Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have reported you for tossing that piece of dog doo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's face is flushed; Barbara calms him by grabbing his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, let's not overreact now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Dokos stomps his feet and thrusts his fist into the air, as a child might if he were overreacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this fucking piece of shit construction stopped now and I want that goddamn roof ripped off and lowered and I don't care if I have to spend a shit load of money to get it done!!  I will do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Barbara simply stare at him in disbelief.  David walks back to his house.  Tom turns to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this house finished before he can stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom rolls up his sleeves and walks toward the house to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and Alyssa walk into the house listless - both lo tired and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa enters the room, walks into the bathroom.  Sam is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan are sitting next to each other on the floor subdued, tossing a ball to Guster.  The kitchen door open and Peter walks into the family room.  Adam is the first notice but the last to react.  Ryan stands as Guster bark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guster, be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter has a growth of beard and is dressed in Levi's and knit shirt - he doesn't look like himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ours.  It's George's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is tough - not giving an inch.  Peter stares at his sons, ashamed that the question could be asked.  Adam sta and walks to this father, takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell Mom you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is asleep, looking dead with tubes in his arms.  W HEAR a bit of the song by Warren Zevon, "MY SHIT'S FUCKED UP."  'Well, I went to the doctor/I said 'I'm feeling kin rough'/He said, 'I'll break it to you, son, your shit's fucked up.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is alone on the roof in the fading light, stringing p lights over the shingles and under the eves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin couldn't look worse as she walks down the hall to t family room with Ryan.  Peter is standing alone.  Ryan jo Adam on the floor with Guster.  Robin stops and stands te feet from Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe... I know it's late...but if you're hungry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has set as Sam stands at the edge of the cliff tr to garner the courage to jump.  After the sound of a wave crashing against the cliff, Sam closes his eyes and leaps the edge of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is sitting on the edge of her bed as Colleen stops beside the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa shakes her head "no".  Colleen walks into the room sits down beside her daughter.  Alyssa rests her head on mother's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin, Peter, Ryan and Adam are in the middle of dinner a Adam excitedly tries to explain all that he and his broth have accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we got to take all the old paint off all the doors and then George taught us how to stain everything and he even let me choose the color I liked best!  And he said he loved me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did a lot of the wiring too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Dale.  Oh, and I got to drill a hole into a board to put the wire through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard you so excited about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can come help us too?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter glances at Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is still wet as he walks down the hall.  We HEAR more the Warren Zevon song. 'I had a dream/Ah, shucks, oh, well/Now it's all fucked up/It's shot to hell.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters the room as a NURSE scurries to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid no one's allowed in here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is staring at George, who is either asleep or unconscious.  The nurse finally relents and walks out.  S sits in a chair beside the bed and begins to cry.  Slowly George's arm slides out beyond the railing of the bed, hi hand open.  Sam does his best to stop crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls out a pair of sunglasses from his shirt pocket. George shakes death and drugs away as he manages to open eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I don't wanna go, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gently slides the sunglasses over his father's eyes; rushes to the window and pulls the curtains back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks back to the bed and pulls it toward the window, stretching the cords and tubes to their limit.  He grabs remote and raises George's head.  Off in the distance, against the backdrop of an endless black ocean, George's house is seemingly on fire with lights.  Pain can't stop smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes hold of Sam's hand with his own.  They conti to stare at the lit house holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Robin, Adam, Ryan and Peter are greete Guster, who bounces around like a wired rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go brush your teeth and get right into bed.  It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam runs to Robin for a kiss, then grabs Peter with a hu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam runs up the stairs, Guster right on his heels.  Ryan staring at his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about building a house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I could teach you some things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin sneaks a quick kiss on Ryan's cheek as he heads for stairs.  After he's gone, Robin turns back to Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hardly recognize you with a beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my plan...to be hardly recognizable to you as me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel in love with George again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter nods, something he already knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin nods.  There's a moment where it's clear that Peter doesn't want to leave and Robin doesn't want him to leave but after the moment passes, Peter walks out and Robin si down at the base of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleen and Alyssa are asleep together on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is up on a ladder, pounding copper nails into cedar shingles that face the house.  Alyssa runs across the gra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating to Catalina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps off the ladder.  Alyssa wraps her arms around h Sam removes sleepy bugs from Alyssa's eyes before he kiss her.  A police car stops in front of the house and Kurt s out.  Alyssa and Sam turn to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he heard hammering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Kurt can answer, David Dokos storms out of his hou and trudges toward them talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My attorney is driving down from Newport Beach.  If I hear one more nail being hammered, I swear to God before this is all over I'll end up owing this house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam is staring at David Dokos, a hint of recognition crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dokos says that your father missed his height envelope by six inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants the entire roof taken off and lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of fear rushes through David Dokos that's instantl visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you drive a black Mercedes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam figures out why we knows David Dokos - from the abort blowjob in the black Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to my house to wait for my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David starts to leave, but Sam stops him with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure we need lawyers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's face is sheet white as he forces himself back aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because all we're really talking about is six inches, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sixteen years old.  I'm underage.  How could I possibly threaten you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Dokos stares at Sam for a long time before glancing Kurt and his police uniform for just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to help us finish the house, Mr. Dokos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything happens for a reason.  That's what my dad said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you tell me, what just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The payoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks back to the ladder and hammer, leaving Kurt and Alyssa confounded.  David takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just...change clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pounds in another shingle as David walks quickly back his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is unconscious as Robin enters and sits down besid him with a video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the last time you were happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin adjusts the viewfinder and presses play on the came George doesn't wake up.  On the tiny screen, we see a you George in the ocean, his arms wrapped around six-year old Sam; he shields Sam from the waves and kisses his son's h Robin rests the camera on the bed as the video continues play.  She takes hold of George's hand and begins to weep she presses her head on his chest.  An envelope with Robi and Sam's name on it rests on the nightstand beside the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty men along with Tom and Barbara, Alyssa and Colleen Sam and David Dokos are painting; installing windows, flo or cabinets as the house begins to take its final shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stops and steps out of his car as Adam and Ryan rac for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you guys feel like painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love red!  That's my favorite color!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan walk into the house as Sam focuses on Peter who keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter glances down at his work clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might be able to help, but it looks like you have all you can handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter nods, hesitates for a moment before walking up the driveway to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's bed is empty, stripped of everything.  Robin is still sitting in a chair beside the bed, a letter resting her lap.  A NURSE stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure we can't call anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin shakes her head "no".  The nurse moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the outside, the house is finished: windows in, door on, roof shingled.  The sun drops behind the house, causi halo of bright light to envelop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the workers have gone home, because most of the w is done.  All the floor are hand-scrapped cherry; huge be and wood planks lend a strength to the ceiling.  The kitc cabinets are in; the bathrooms are complete.  Sam, Ryan, Alyssa, Adam and Peter are the only ones left.  Outside, hear a car pull to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan run down the stairs.  Peter stops cleaning brush and walks to the window as Sam stands still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam runs to Robin and meets her mid-yard with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does George get to come see his house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Robin are staring at the house.  Ryan can see th strain on his mother's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is George okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Robin can do is shake her head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam backs away from the window.  Peter turns to face him. Standing straight as he can, being as brave as he can, te well in Sam's eyes as he softly shakes.  Peter walks to S and wraps his arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought of myself as a house.  I was always what I lived in.  It didn't need to be big.  It didn't even need to be beautiful.  I just needed to be mine.  I became what I was meant to be.  I built myself a life.  I built myself a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam clings to Peter, completely lost in sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Ryan have their arms wrapped around their mother we pull back and watch the sun set the sky off in dazzlin hues of orange and red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is driving with Sam beside her in a low-middle inco neighborhood in Santa Ana.  Sam is holding the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could keep it and rent it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the letter.  You read the will.  He wants you to keep it.  To live in it some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe this isn't what he wants, but this what he was hoping for. (beat) Maybe it's what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear to see that Robin's proud of Sam's decision. checks an address on a piece of paper and pulls to a stop Sam steps out of the car, holding the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is shaking slightly as he walks up the cracked concre walk to the door.  He RINGS the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one years ago, my father crossed a double-line.  He changed my life and the life of a little girl forever with that mistake.  I just can't stop thinking about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN in her mid-twenties opens the door in her wheelch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is very nervous as he reaches in his pocket and pulls a set of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father built you a house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is confused as Sam holds out the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is majestic in its setting among the trees and grass, on the jagged just of rock that accepts the consta crash of ocean against it with a solid permanence.  This where, if you were a house, you would want to be built.
